title: Game streaming from cloud will be the future of gaming? What do you think? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think the shareholders and CEO’s want it to be the future of gaming: No piracy Monthly fees No costs for distribution of hardware/games No R&D for hardware No warranty for hardware No need to provide tech support for hardware Many, many more cost savings The gamer’s? Some do, the vast majority don’t. I doubt it’ll take off like they think it will. Most gamer’s are happy with the current solution. EDIT: Where I think it will be profitable is not as a replacement service but as a supplementary service like Geforce now or Xcloud that isn’t too expensive.

Shareholders and Mr moneybags want it to be the future of gaming because it has many things that hurt the consumer. It has DRM which prevents the player from selling or buying games from unofficial sources, monthly fees which makes them able to gain a income every month. It can also be done for very cheap making it a low cost investment for the consumer, and high profit for mr moneybags. No, i don’t think it’s going to be the future of gaming.
